website_summaries.verdict: A highly-rated, hard-shell shin guard pair that are an excellent value for a comfortable fit.
pros: Sizes range from XX-small to large, and fit children and adults
Hook-and-loop strap around calf wraps fastens in front of shin guard and doesn’t irritate skin
Back of hard plastic is padded for comfort
Quality on par with more expensive name-brand shin guards
Lots of colors to choose from
Good ankle protection and general coverage
cons: Sizing using the measurement chart is unreliable
Some recommend ordering a size up

customer_reviews.title: Nice shin guards
customer_reviews.text: Nice shin guards. I don't really know what makes for good shin guards but my son likes them and you can't beat the price. Medium fit my son well. He is 4'9" and 9 years old. Couldnt find a size chart under product info so found a chart online aand that's what I used. Attaching pic of size chart for anyone looking.
customer_reviews.author: birdistheword328Top Contributor: Running

customer_reviews.title: Size SMALL, fits my 4ft tall 5 year old
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is five years old and juuuuuust shy of four feet tall. These seem to fit her pretty well. Her first practice is tomorrow so I will update my review after she tells me how they feel through a 90 minute practice.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Nice Fit.
customer_reviews.text: We purchase size small. These fit perfectly. My son is 5 soon to be 6 in in November.
customer_reviews.author: William Tomlin

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, but pay attention to sizing. Size up.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the xxs for my 4 yr old who is tiny (37 in tall and 26 lbs). They are just right for her but according to the sizing chart on the package I should have ordered smaller. Definitely size up.
customer_reviews.author: KGS

customer_reviews.title: Finally!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried on every brand of shin guards they have in the stores trying to find something that fit my 3 year old. She's just over 3 feet tall but has buff calf muscles. I got her the XXS and they are perfect. They actually cover her shin and the strap goes around her calf comfortably. The Velcro hooks over the front of the guard so no worries about it irritating her skin. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: C. STEVENS

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I kick my daughter's shins repeatedly and she remains unharmed.
customer_reviews.author: Chubby Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good product! Size S is suitable for 6 to 7 years.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for beginning player
customer_reviews.text: My son's first year playing soccer (he's 6) and we purchased these after reading the reviews for value and easy to use. Neither my husband nor I are soccer players, so this was new for us all. We have been pleased with these shin guards and they have held up well to a very active, and enthusiastic player. The coaches said they are a great guard for the dollar amount, and we anticipate these surviving the season and will purchase them again in a bigger size once he's grows out of these. Seller was easy to work with when we initially purchased the incorrect size - courteous, prompt, and well-informed.
customer_reviews.author: Ally Roscoe

customer_reviews.title: Fast delivery
customer_reviews.text: Fast speedy delivery. Which is becoming rare despite having a prime membership. This item was shipped and received in 2 days. We ordered a size small for our 6 year old and they fit perfect. She was a little reluctant to have the strap under her feet, but by the time we got to the soccer field she forgot all about it. I would have given a 5 star, but they did not have the NOCSAE stamp. Not sure that is necessary at this level of play. Now if we would only received the shoes and socks ordered at the same time. (Obviously from a different seller).
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: and they fit perfect. I'm 5'10"
customer_reviews.text: For $11, I was a bit skeptical about the quality. Too my surprise, these no-name brand shin guards are on par with the $40-50 priced shin guards. I ordered an adult Large, and they fit perfect. I'm 5'10", 210 lbs. They fit just right, and give me the feel of ample protection.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Look at the reviews/comments to figure out sizing
customer_reviews.text: We have a tall 11 year old girl (5'2") so got the Large and it was just right. I looked at the reviews from others to figure out that she would probably need the Large and I was right to do that. There is a nice extra pad around the ankle which is key, because she plays defender and folks cut across her ankle bones all the time. These cover a good amount of the shin without dropping down too low on the ankle. My daughter also likes the wrap-around closure so she can get the tightness just right.
customer_reviews.author: CBH

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: These are very cute! I ordered the extra small for my 3 year old daughter and they fit her perfect (she's a bit on the short side). The only thing I don't like is that the strap wraps around the front of the shin guard then attaches. It hold it firm in place but the strap covers part of the shin guard
customer_reviews.author: LisaP

customer_reviews.title: These fit our 10-year-old daughter well and were comfortable for her to wear throughout the season
customer_reviews.text: These fit our 10-year-old daughter well and were comfortable for her to wear throughout the season. Our daughter is in the average range for height and weight for a 10 yo and the medium is a perfect fit. The Large size was too long to fit correctly
customer_reviews.author: H. E. Q. Lane

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the generic ones
customer_reviews.text: These shin guards are much better than the generic nike ones you get at your local sporting goods store. The elastic portion that covers the ankle is slightly padded, the guard itself seems extremely well made of high quality plastic and is backed by a thick layer of soft material. Also, the velcro strap is designed such that it goes around the calf and then sticks to the other end on the front of the shin guard... more comfortable to wear. Excellent value for money.
customer_reviews.author: manbearpig

customer_reviews.title: great for the shin, unless you're kicked on the side.
customer_reviews.text: I am currently dealing with a massive hematoma from being kicked while wearing these shin guards. I was kicked on the side, and I believe the edge of the shinguard dug into my shin/calf. This is not a reflection on this particular shin guard, but this type of shin guard in general as I've had the same problem with another brand with similar structure. I guess I need a shin guard without an edge that wraps around my entire leg.
customer_reviews.author: M.J.

customer_reviews.title: Best shin guards
customer_reviews.text: My son loves his shin guards! He loved that the Velcro wraps around to the front. His last ones had strapped Velcro in the back. It always scraped his calves. He loved these. I need to buy more for my other son. My son is 9 yrs old & 49 inches. He has thick legs. We bought the medium. I recommend highly. He says they do not hurt like his last ones. Big plus! Very durable and love the color.
customer_reviews.author: Raquel

customer_reviews.title: These protect well and I enjoyed the added ankle support thanks to the thick bottom ...
customer_reviews.text: As a 5' 2" female, I ordered a medium base on the size chart. They're a bit short, but I needed them in a pinch and did not have time to exchange for a larger size, but I feel the large might be too tall and hit my knee caps. These protect well and I enjoyed the added ankle support thanks to the thick bottom straps. The curve of these just fit my legs, so I would only advise use of these by children, teens, and smaller women.
customer_reviews.author: Cheese and PackersTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Great price! Easy to put on and take off. My daughter is really picky about how things feel when she wears them and she had no issues with these. Figuring out the size was more difficult than it should of been. I purchased the xsmall for my daughter who is 41" tall. These fit her perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: mWit

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 6 year old. She loves pink, so that was a huge plus. She really likes the feel of these. Her old guards were made a bit differently and she found them uncomfortable. These she gets on by herself with no issue, and the fact that they fasten over the guard itself makes it much more comfortable for her. She no longer complains about her guards but rather puts them on quite happily!
customer_reviews.author: krista

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Got the small for a tall 7 year old and I expect he'll be able to wear them for at least a year. These are a fun color and seem to provide solid protection. I especially like that the velcro wraps around the back of the leg and then attaches in front; it's much more comfortable and secure than having the velcro in the back.
customer_reviews.author: DMC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect. Price, quality and fit so much better than high priced name brands.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased Vizari Malaga shin guards after trying several other name brands. These are well made, fit nice and fasten in the front so there is no itchy scratchy velcro on back of calf. Grandson is stout 9 yr old 4'11" and 112 lbs. We ordered the youth/adult sz medium. Trying to get the right size for him after ordering other name brands that did not fit well was trying, but these are perfect. He says they are comfortable and easy to get on and off. They also have the padded ankle protection which is a plus. Price is very reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: tdptuffy

customer_reviews.title: Medium fits perfect for 9 year old
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a medium for my 9 year old daughter. It covers her entire shin. She says they are very comfortable and likes them much better than her old shin guards. I like that there is no Velcro running against her calf as it fastens in the front.
customer_reviews.author: Birdy529

customer_reviews.title: They fit great!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased size S, my son is 3’7” and they fit perfect. These are pulled up over the foot and I like that they have some padding around the ankle. I feel these are better than shin guards that are just placed on top of the shin and under the sock for that reason. Even though it is difficult for him to put them on. They’re perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Adam B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a size small for my 7 year old and they fit perfectly. He wears them over his soccer socks and says they're really comfortable. We're happy customers!
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: Sizing chart incorrect
customer_reviews.text: They look like they will do the job. Unfortunately, the sizing chart is incorrect so had to return them and buy a different pair at a store because couldn't wait for shipping. I suggest Amazon to take a closer look at sellers with sizing charts. From past experience, many of the sizing chats are off from clothes to gloves and anything to do with size in general especially from third party sellers!
customer_reviews.author: Dad75

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loves pink so this is perfect for her soccer league
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves pink so this is perfect for her soccer league, she's six. Come to find out, the kids her age are required to wear socks OVER their chin pads, bummer. I'm not too familiar with soccer uniforms and gear but by placing the chin guards directly against her leg then putting socks over them, makes her chin's sweat and uncomfortable for her. So she wears her tights then places the pads over that, then we put her socks over her pads, making it 3 layers. My husband wants to cut off the strap that's supposed to be placed under her foot for it won't fit right with her soccer shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Mazy

customer_reviews.title: Best ones we have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: My son is 7 but on the taller side and these fit him perfectly at 4ft 7 in. I like the stretchy part and strap at bottom that foot slips through. It supports the ankle while protecting the shin. The straps are far more comfortable than previous ones he has had. On other ones we had to put on socks then shin guard then soccer socks so they didnt hurt him. Very pleased and will order again next year as he grows 4 inches or so every year.
customer_reviews.author: Heather or James

customer_reviews.title: Best guards I've bought in 4 years!
customer_reviews.text: The medium size fits my 9 year old son perfectly. He's about 56 inches tall and not quite 70 pounds. These are easy on, easy off even with the ankle guard attached, and they are the most comfortable since the velcro meets on the front of the shin guard instead of the back of the leg, so no scratchy velcro on the skin!
customer_reviews.author: H. L. GRAHAM

customer_reviews.title: These shin guards held up fine through a season of soccer- protected well
customer_reviews.text: These shin guards held up fine through a season of soccer- protected well, are still intact/usable, and looked great. Only downside for me was the sizing. I ordered the medium and they seemed slightly too small so then I ordered the large and they were slightly too big. So, it was hard to find the right fit for me as I seemed to be in between a medium and large.
customer_reviews.author: JSP85

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality but the size chart is off
customer_reviews.text: I measured my sons legs three times to make sure that the shin guards would fit and of course they didn’t. Size up soccer families. I ordered the xxs based on the size chart and measurements and these could fit my 6 month old daughter better. Such a bummer. With that being said, the quality is very nice.
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: perfect for my 5-6-7 year old
customer_reviews.text: have had these for a couple of years now through outdoor & indoor soccer. very easy for my kid to put on by himself. his only complaint is that he gets some irritation around the ankle, so we resolve that by wearing a pair of ankle socks underneath and then his full soccer socks on top of the shin guards. they are light weight, but durable enough to give him good protection.
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great shin guards!
customer_reviews.text: I keep buying these shin guards in larger sizes, because my son says they're comfortable, he likes them and they're a good price. When he needs new ones, as he grows, I just keep buying these ones. Why mess with what works? They're also easy to toss in the washing machine. I don't put them in the dryer, I hang them to dry, but they have held up really well.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent set of shin guards, good quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: These fit my step son very well, I think the xsmall would have fit him slightly better (he's a pretty tall 4 year old) but these should do fine for this season. The ankle protection is awesome and I love how the strap goes over the front of the guard so that it doesn't dig in to sensitive skin. He was able to move around comfortably and had no issues with the fit at all. Can't believe how good the quality is for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Alynn

customer_reviews.title: Great value-priced shin guards
customer_reviews.text: For the price, these shinguards are a good value. Priced under $15, you're unlikely to find a pair that blends safety and style so well. The only downfall of the shin guards is the foam backing that holds in the heat/moisture on your shins. As a result, your shins will get sweaty and potentially a little uncomfortable - but that's easily remedied. Are these on par with $50 shin guards - no. But, they are significantly less expensive. Overall, a solid purchase at a good price point - I would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: snazzyman

customer_reviews.title: Strap broke after one season (
customer_reviews.text: Yes these were cheap and served their purpose for a while, but they broke after a year/one season of playing soccer only once per week. Personally I don't like disposable items and think it would be nice to pass on shin guards to a friend, siblings or even grandchildren when my seven year old son is outgrown his. So I am re-ordering another pair from Adidas. They don't have 4.5 star reviews, only 4 star but I don't trust the stars as much as I used to anymore. They are a reputable brand and my son loved their more interesting design.
customer_reviews.author: G.Webb

customer_reviews.title: Medium fits my 4 yr old
customer_reviews.text: I originally ordered an XS based on the sizing chart, but they were way too tiny for my son. My 4 yr old is a tall kid - 4'2" and 40 lbs - and the medium fits nicely...if not a tad large. The Small might have fit perfectly but he would outgrow in a few months. The medium, with a pair of socks and new shoes work perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Didday

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shin guards
customer_reviews.text: We bought these as a replacement for shin guards we had previously purchased in store, store brand. The previous ones had hard velcro strips that kept digging into my sons leg when we would put his socks on over them. These fixed the problem, the soft elastic velcro band wraps around the entire calf and velcro on the front so it doesn't have a chance of irritating his leg. We'll be buying another pair for our other son too.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hager

customer_reviews.title: Picked over Nike and Addidas
customer_reviews.text: I heard that Shin guards are the hardest soccer item to purchase for. My 8 yrs old son has been playing soccer for past 3yrs and we tried nike and addias in the past. I didnt know what Vizari was till I found this one at Amazon. I picked this pair because the reviews and ratings were good. Now I know why. They fit well and the coverage is excellent. I have to say it provides best ankle protection coverage for a shin guard Size Medium perfectly fits my 8yrs old who is 90lbs and 4’5 tall
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Just okay
customer_reviews.text: I bought these and wound up returning them. The medium was too big for my almost 8 year old (smaller that average boy) and the small seemed really small. Since they were angled at the top, they would hit his knee as he ran in them and after just a 1 hour practice in them, his knee was noticeably irritated and wound up bruised. I went to a local store and it helped me realize how not amazing quality these shin guards were.
customer_reviews.author: srnoot

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: This is my daughter’s second pair of shin guards. Her first pair was adidas. I thought I would try these because they were a little cheaper-bad idea. We aren’t even half way they her season and one of the Velcro pieces that wraps around the shin guard to hold it down tore right out of the shin guards when we were putting them on. Spend the extra money and buy the better brands.
customer_reviews.author: JMS

customer_reviews.title: Nice overall, but ankle component uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: For 7 y/o girl - size S - shin guard was comfortable and fit well (size accurate). She was complaining about it being uncomfortable and rubbing, so we did some creative cutting with scissors around the ankle strap/ankle padding, and no issues since. So - overall solid shin guard, just note you may have to do some adjusting/cutting for it to be comfortable in some instances.
customer_reviews.author: A. Reback

customer_reviews.title: Great fitment.
customer_reviews.text: Love these! My daughter is a smaller framed 9 year old. I measured her ankle to shin at 8.5 inches. We order the pink large, fit perfect. She’s uses them for field hockey.
customer_reviews.author: Stan Traylor

customer_reviews.title: Beware....
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my son who needs this for soccer and when it arrived on game day one of the shin guards had the stocking part attached to the front of the shin guard on the outside where there was no possible way to be able to wear it. Very disappointed! The coach won’t let him play until he has them.... and this happens
customer_reviews.author: Lynne

customer_reviews.title: Fit like a glove
customer_reviews.text: These are great and toddler approved. I got them for 3 1/2 year old xxs and they fit perfectly. Right under the knee maybe a 2” space between the bottom of the knee and when the shin guard top touched. I have these in black and blue. There’s a review for the blue. We could’ve gotten an xs that might have lasted for next season but it might have been a bit big and could’ve made him feel uncomfortable. Beside the whole purpose is protective/snug fit
customer_reviews.author: Suzette Acosta

customer_reviews.title: Great shin and ankle protection, great value
customer_reviews.text: We have had about 4 sets of these and they are really good shin guards. We prefer these over Nike and the price is good. The ankle protection is just good enough to compensate for sloppy tackles from opposing defenders, but they are not overly bulky. After a while the ankle padding shifts a little bit, but it's not a big deal. You have to sacrifice the convenience of guards that you can slip in and out of socks easily, but the ankle protection is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark J. Pescatrice

customer_reviews.title: Run of the mill shin guard
customer_reviews.text: Great shin guards and do the trick. Would I buy these again? Probably not. The arch inside the guard doesn’t fit my peanut of a 5 year old well and by well I mean they’re still to narrow when I was sure they’d be to wide if anything. It doesn’t inhibit her playing and she doesn’t seem to mind but they’re mediocre to me. Cheap plastic but it keeps her safe.
customer_reviews.author: Breanne Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: One of the elastic straps at the bottom of one shin guard was shorter than the other making shinguard uncomfortable and leading to stretching/tearing of elastic on that one after less than a month of use. I can't figure out how to make a complaint to the seller and the 30 day return policy has just passed. I will not buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: IronmanZ68

customer_reviews.title: Solid!
customer_reviews.text: These are great but it took my daughter a little while to get used to them because she was required to wear socks over them and it was a little too bulky for that and as a but of a tight fit. But she eventually got used to them and the protection is great. But if you’re looking for more comfort - then the socks with built in guards are better for that.
customer_reviews.author: Runwayturtle

customer_reviews.title: I should have gotten the Large even though I am 5'1" the medium feel a bit short. Nicely made otherwise.
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'1" adult female. Many of my other dimensions would fit the average size 10 year old. after reading reviews I got the Medium. I wish I got the Large. The Medium seam a little short on my shin but may be just fine to protect me from injury. I just wish they went a bit higher. I am going to use them to protect my shins from injury while bicycling. I have been it by the pedals before and still have a scar. I got the black ones. I will report more after I go riding
customer_reviews.author: Artful ALF

customer_reviews.title: Great fit
customer_reviews.text: Had to buy shin guards in not a lot of time, I didn't want to buy the cheapo Wal-Mart brand again as they just don't fit my daughter right. These not only fit her shin, but the added band around her ankle and strap under her foot is an added perk. They fit well (I did base my purchase size on a review picture of the package), my daughter said they are comfortable and I loved the price. I will likely buy more in the future
customer_reviews.author: Kendra Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I bought two pairs for my two girls 7 and 8 that are almost same in height and weight (50 lbs and 46 inches). These work great for their indoor soccer sessions, haven't had a chance to try them out for outdoors yet but I don't see why not. I was worried their sneakers won't fit after putting these around their heels but so far we had no issues. I didn't even buy any special long socks, they just wear these over their normal socks.
customer_reviews.author: ASH

customer_reviews.title: Great shin guards
customer_reviews.text: Bought a pair for my three kiddos and they are pretty great! My kids find them comfortable and they are priced well. Follow the size chart to measure their shins for the right size. My 6 and 8 year old are average size for their age and could both fit in the small size well (my 8 year old could have probably sized up and been fine).
customer_reviews.author: J-mann

customer_reviews.title: Strap is a little uncomfortable, but otherwise these are fine.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shin guards for my son. He says they're mostly ok, but he complains that the strap (that wraps around the leg) is itchy. He doesn't notice it as much anymore, but in the beginning it really bothered him. Still, they seem to be just fine for him now, so I'm ok with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ladybug

customer_reviews.title: Kiddo doesn't complain about discomfort
customer_reviews.text: Went through three different shin guards before settling on this guy. Picky kiddo complaints about anything uncomfortable to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Maile Young Karris

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my son who is 20 months old. He play rough and I wanted something just to protect his legs not specifically for playing soccer although he loves that too. They fit great and he loves wearing them. Would definitely recommend. Also his are the smallest size so I believe the XXS.
customer_reviews.author: Karen A.

customer_reviews.title: 10 year old likes these
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves that the velcro folds over the front of the shin instead of on the back of her calf like other shin guards. We've tried others that slip in but those do not stay in place for her or those too have velcro against her leg, so we went back to the sock design. She's happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: CRoes

customer_reviews.title: A bit too small
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old is 42 inches & 40 lbs. I bought the XS and wish I bought the Small. The calf width molding is a bit too narrow for my son's shins which makes it uncomfortable for him. It is a good product. What you see is what you get.
customer_reviews.author: E.LaBarre

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for both my boys!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't going to order these because of all the size issues in the comments I read but then I ran into a family that had a pair at the soccer field. I ordered a medium for my 7 year old and a small for my 4 yr old and they are perfect for both. The straps make it easy for the boys to get them on since they velcro in the front. Very happy with these!
customer_reviews.author: Jewels

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: These are so cute. My 3 (almost 4) year old uses it for soccer when she isnt using the socks with the built in guard. It doesnt bother her and she's comfortable. I personally like the ease of use with the built in sock guard combo...but these work and they are cute.
customer_reviews.author: T M.

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the price, my daighter likes them.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered medium for my 9 year old, I could have probably gone a size smaller but she likes how they fit. This is our first year doing soccer so we aren't experts. They have a decent amount of padding and seem pretty good quality, id recommen them.
customer_reviews.author: Jess1214

customer_reviews.title: Overall good. Read review
customer_reviews.text: Wish their sizing was better. Hard to figure out what would fit. Ended up getting one that as too small and now am running out of time to buy proper ones before camp starts. Besided that, everything does looks great including the ankle cover gizmos.
customer_reviews.author: HS

customer_reviews.title: My 8 year old uses these for soccer and they ...
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old uses these for soccer and they fit perfectly under his socks. We purchased the size small and he is 48 inches tall.
customer_reviews.author: Erika Franson

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought the largest one for my average sized eight year old. All the kids shin guards I see only cover about half the shin and that doesn’t make sense to me! So I bought this adult sized one and it covers his entire shin. Very happy
customer_reviews.author: Carmella

customer_reviews.title: Did great for my Daughter
customer_reviews.text: Covered my Daughter's shins well. She is 4'3". It says not to machine wash. But I put hers in with a load of towels on hand wash cycle and they did fine. I didn't add fabric softener. I feel that would ruin the shin pad. Then air dry.
customer_reviews.author: Tomieka Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Nice Value Shin Guard For the Fall Season
customer_reviews.text: Great deal on a quality soccer shin guard set. Sure they don't cost a lot and they aren't nike or adidas, but who cares... the socks cover them anyway. They may not last YEARS either, but nothing I buy this kid lasts that long, no matter what I spend on it! They fit great, and protect well. For a 10 year old boy, I got the medium.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: the 4 year old loves them for his soccer practice and games they fit him perfect
customer_reviews.author: daniel hill

customer_reviews.title: Great for my PREK soccer player
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves these shin gaurds because they are pink, I like them for the price and how durable they are. She has used them 3x a week for the past month and no problems. I always worry about blisters, but she didn't get any using these.
customer_reviews.author: MIG

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for smaller kids!
customer_reviews.text: This is a much better design than other leading companies. Out tiny humans are so sensitive to what they wear and having Velcro rub on their skin is not ok. So this was a winner for sure!! Fit my skinny 4 year old perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Lee

customer_reviews.title: Should have sized up!
customer_reviews.text: My son is 6 years old, he is tall and about 65 pounds. I read the reviews and ordered a small. I should have sized up, but they will do for this season. It is only rec soccer so I am not TOO concerned. If you have the bigger and taller 6 year old, I would do a medium. Overall I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Holly L.

customer_reviews.title: Order up a size or 2.
customer_reviews.text: So far my 4 year old loves these. They stay in place well and he can pretty much get them by himself. He hasn't complained about them being itchy or rubbing on his legs like he has with others. I take away one star because the sizing is inaccurate. My son is roughly 41" tall and the XS barely fit him, I should have ordered him a S I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Kellie Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: These fit my 5.5 year old perfect. I love that they have the stirrup! She wears a size 5/6 and is about 40 inches tall. Very soft padding and overall couldn't be happier. Note these and the soccer socks together do add a lot to the shoe so if your shopping for shoes also, size up!
customer_reviews.author: Lannie

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price.
customer_reviews.text: They are good for the price. If you have a daughter who's just trying out soccer for the first time or isn't serious. They're a little small and she said they're a bit uncomfortable. But they worked for a season of rec soccer. And they're pink...
customer_reviews.author: Scott B

customer_reviews.title: Excellent protection and comfort
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant, as I've never heard of this brand before. But these shin guards are really well made: good protection, they are comfortable, they don't move (the strap system is much better than other brands). Definitely the best shin guard I've ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: XS perfect for 4 year old! Durable!
customer_reviews.text: The XS was perfect for our 4 year old, with thinner socks I was able to fit her into Dream Pairs cleats with the ankle protection. These guards are comfortable on her and great quality. Also pictured is a BLACKHAWK size 3 soccer ball. These are also durable and perfect size for our little ones!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer's Family

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and comfort.
customer_reviews.text: These look great and per the 5-year-old who can't stand scratchy or saggy things, these are very comfortable with the perfect amount of compression. My 5-year-old is a tiny bit on the smaller size but these fit well enough and he has plenty of room to grow.
customer_reviews.author: LY

customer_reviews.title: Son loves them.
customer_reviews.text: Only reason I gave 4 not 5 stars is because I had to stretch the ankle portion despite going with a larger size so my 9 yo son's foot could get through. He hasn't worn his other pair since he got these.
customer_reviews.author: Boyd Craven

customer_reviews.title: Got shredded!!
customer_reviews.text: Was pretty excited to find these at first, but within two practices they were starting to fray and by the end of the season they we pretty shredded apart. I'll be looking for another pair next year. Was hoping these would last more than a season (8 weeks, 16 times worn)
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Kittel

customer_reviews.title: Good pair, just check sizing
customer_reviews.text: I am 5' 3" and weigh about 145. I purchased the large, since they seem to be intended for children. This pair is too big on me. I am afraid I am going to have to return them for a size smaller! Over all, comfortable with good coverage!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These do the job
customer_reviews.text: Not very many options for toddlers but these do the job. At first my son didn't like the elastic band at the bottom but he got used to it with time. I was thinking if necessary I could remove it and just add some tape to the outside of the sock if he really didn't like it.
customer_reviews.author: Erbo

customer_reviews.title: Got a size medium for my 10 year old (who ...
customer_reviews.text: Got a size medium for my 10 year old (who is on the smaller side) and they fit just below his knee without hindering his movement. They seem very well made, look stylish and the price was right. I'll be coming back for a second pair for my oldest before next soccer season!
customer_reviews.author: MelNH

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, we’ve used these for two soccer seasons and they’re still in great shape. We bought the same ones when our next kiddo started playing.
customer_reviews.author: Christoson

customer_reviews.title: Work Well, She Loved Them, Seems on the Small Side
customer_reviews.text: These were exactly what our daughter needed for her Upwards soccer matches... being a smaller kid in the middle school age range means those girls kick HARD! These were great to help protect her, especially when she was playing goalie. The only reason I went with 4 out of 5 stars is that they seem to run small and I am afraid they won't even fit next season. Maybe I can sneak them under one of her younger brothers' socks next year?
customer_reviews.author: Crissi (Fraz Zled Momma to Many)

customer_reviews.title: Broke after one season
customer_reviews.text: I REALLY liked these, they were so cute...but unfortunately they broke after one season (roughly a couple months). The velcro strap just came completely off and now they can't be secured at the top anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Get a larger size. They'll still fit.
customer_reviews.text: Best feature is that the ankle guard is attached to the shin guard, so less shifting. I recommend getting a larger size. They'll still fit, as the recommended size for kids' soccer shin guards is much smaller than common sense would dictate.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan in Arizona

customer_reviews.title: Don’t love the strap under foot
customer_reviews.text: Daughter doesn’t care for the strap under her foot so we have pull up on her ankle so she isn’t stepping on it. This is her first year of soccer so wearing shin guards is already an adjustment.
customer_reviews.author: Linzy B.

customer_reviews.title: Buy 2 sizes too big!  They run VERY small
customer_reviews.text: They DO RUN SMALL!!! I got my 6 year old daughter a Small. She’s worn XS in other brands. They are DEFINITELY small. The straps go OVER the shin guard too. It’s kind of a weird setup. They are cheap. Good for the price, but probably wouldn’t buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Jon F

customer_reviews.title: Great value! Perfect for 4 year old!
customer_reviews.text: Great for our 4 year olds first soccer season. Quality is great for the money and they fit him perfectly! He’s a little over 3 1/2 feet tall. Would definitely recommend these, especially for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Good shin guards
customer_reviews.text: Works fine my daughter is on the smaller side for a 7yo. We got the s-youth and they hit just right. Easy to get on and off. The price was good too especially if she only does one season
customer_reviews.author: Cench624

customer_reviews.title: Protects from sisters too
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old plays soccer at school. He asked his sister to kick him to see if the guards would protect him. Of course she was happy to do so and thank god he had them on to protect his shins! Worked great at the soccer games too!
customer_reviews.author: Oranit

customer_reviews.title: Great shin pads
customer_reviews.text: These are great shin pads. My girls are tiny and they fit perfectly plus the added bottom portion helps to keep them in place and keeps them from sliding up or down. The girls are quite picky and they never said they didn’t want to put these on. Plus of course they loved that they were pink even though they went under their socks. We used them all season and can still wear them next season too. Definitely a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Borkowski

customer_reviews.title: great for the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace a cheaper pair I initially bought for my son and they fell apart within weeks. These are nice and tall, durable, and comfortable. My son really likes these.
customer_reviews.author: Green Sweetie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my 5yo twin boys
customer_reviews.text: They hold up pretty well, even for the tiny legs. My boys are small for their age. They are 6yo in 2 months but they wear 5T clothes. These shin guards are the right size for their small-soccer-kicking-legs. They have not complained after 3 weeks of soccer.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Ford

customer_reviews.title: Too big
customer_reviews.text: The sizing information should be updated or clarified. Ordered a size small, they were too big for my son (he is 3). Small would probably fit a 5 year old. I'll hang on to them since I may need them in two years...
customer_reviews.author: Mama knows best!

customer_reviews.title: Must buy!
customer_reviews.text: These are AWESOME! Easy to use, great value and for well. They don’t leave marks on my toddler’s leg like some of the others and he can take them off himself after games. He’s taken quite a few hard kicks and tramples this season and come home with zero bruises. We will stick to this brand next season!
customer_reviews.author: KAITLYN TINSLEY

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought size large for my very skinny, 5'6", 11y.o. girl. They worked great for her. No complaint. Probably 4th pair we have bought for her in last few years. She says they are the best she has had.
customer_reviews.author: Hananilee

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for the second time. Got XS youth first time around; the following year got the next size up for kids soccer. Easy to put on and fits well under/over high socks. Youth S size fits 6yo fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and great sizing
customer_reviews.text: Daughter loves these. Says they are more comfortable than any others she has worn. Sizing was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Bartlett

customer_reviews.title: Small size and cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Item was cheap and the size ran way smaller than was stated I am highly upset along with grandson he was supposed to start soccer this sat and now he cant because they dont fit
customer_reviews.author: Diane Mikula

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: We have 3 sets of these and they are great. They are good for the price, they seem to be comfortable for my kids and I like the padding they have around the ankles also.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my son for soccer season. He's currently in high school. These get the job done. They are much sturdier than a cheap pair bought at Walmart. He loves the stirrup that goes under his foot too. He said it feels more secure that way. Will definitely buy another pair when the time comes.
customer_reviews.author: Jaimie Paige

product_meta.title: Vizari Malaga Soccer Shin Guards for Kids | Soccer Gear for Boys Girls | Protective Soccer Equipment | Adjustable Straps
product_meta.description: Lightweight PP shell for protection. Foam padded backing for comfort. Hard shell with foam backing for added protection.
feature_bullets: Size Small is recommended for child up to 4'7"
Kindly refer size chart image before purchase

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
